The whole process, you’re

Except it felt incredibly

I hated the bit

You just look like

You look like you’ve had too

I liked that bit where I

that felt like quite sexy.
I was like, “Hey, yeah.
I’m just carrying a child.”

It was really nice

It was wavy and long.
And there was more of it.
And I had beautiful nails.
That was really nice.

The come down from

But I’d say, the

is a really great time,
because you’re still

So that was awesome.

The first time
I was pregnant,

I didn’t get stretch marks
until the last month.

With him it was way more
challenging on my body.
I put on more weight.

Funny enough, the stretch
marks are not the thing

Because my boobs are huge, way

And they fell a bit.
It’s life.
You know, it’s gravity.

And in the beginning, I

and I was telling my

“I’m going to get a boob job

The funny thing is is

And then you get pregnant.

And then you slowly

But when you

30 years to accept and to love

and to figure out
and figure out

what works and doesn’t

it’s a completely

I think that’s where my issues

Not being able to wear your
own clothes sounds trivial.

But actually, just
is another thing

that really makes you
not feel like yourself.

And it’s one of the things
that makes your life
legible to you.

Feeling my boyfriend
slightly recoil from me,
like on a sexual level.

Like he would probably
object to that word,

but feeling that shift

as no longer a sexual

“I don’t want to

I want to look after you.”

I expected lots

And I was prepared

But I wasn’t expecting

I really didn’t

But I was never really too

But the minute I gave birth, I

That took long, long time and

But I mean, I’m talking about

The last couple of

I lost all sensation

So one after another, all
10 fingertips went numb.

It’s some syndrome

I think it took probably

If you can’t feel

it’s a very weird

care of a very little child.

So that was a big thing.
